how did you make this

The same way everybody makes the internets. Pixie dust and unicorn tears! Actually it's built using HTML5, CSS, and Javascript. It's using an awesome static site generator called Jekyll to manage content. The beautiful cascade of styles are sitting on top of Normalize by Nicholas Galhager and the incredibly useful Bourbon by the good folks over at ThoughtBot. Fun fact, the only image on the page is the mountains in the hero element up at the top of the page.

Are you a designer or a developer?

I consider myself a full stack designer. Or a frontend architect. Or a user experience maven. What's do the cool kids say these days? I like solving problems simply and beautifully. I studied design in school and taught myself how to code to continue solving more interesting and relevant problems. Most days my time is split between the sketchbook-and-CS phase and the Sublime-Text-browser-resize phase.

You know that's not our logo, right?

Yes, I do. But it did show up on your twitter, plus it was fun to tackle making it in pure CSS. If you want to see how I did it, check it out here.

No animals, fictional or other wise, were harmed in the creation of this website.
